name: Cards and Castles
description: Collectible cards come to life in this tactics and CCG hybrid! Collect cards, build decks, and challenge players head to head on a Tactical Game Board. Play as Vikings, Pirates, Ninjas and more!

reviews.review_text: Im absolutely in love with this game. With how much Ive played, it doesnt seem P2W what so ever. YES, you can buy decks and campains. Welcome to my new favorite game! I was a long long time player of a similiar game called Poxnora back in the day but then taht game got bought out by Sony and collapsed before reviving once again with a new group... but I am totally burned out on Poxnora there are too many expansions with too many crazy abilities to make any kind of sense out of it anymore. THis game is a simplified version with chess like logic but a nice variety of abilities and spells that keeps you guessing on your toes all the time. I love the free card packs, I pulled a friggin something legendary that looks like the Eye of Sauron and it was so much fun to figure out how to play it. I highly recommend this game!

*Editing Review after continued gameplay and reconsideration*  Initially, I gave this game a negative review, mainly due to a few bugs that only occurred once. That being said, after playing this game for a few hours more, those bugs have yet to occur again, and, since I realize now that the bugs aren't commonplace, I can give a better review.  First and foremost, being that this game is free to play, it is certainly worth a try, for those who enjoy turn-based strategy games. That being said, this game has a lot to offer for fans of this genre. This game offers ways for people with different play-styles to enjoy the game with others; there are different deck types that you can use. Do you enjoy utilizing a strategy involving keeping your cards healed, while also playing offensively? There is a deck for that. Do you enjoy having tank-type cards to rush the enemy castle in a blitzkrieg type fashion? There is also a deck for that.  All-in-all, if you play your cards right (pun intended), you can almost always come out on top, therefore making for an enjoyable, yet challenging, gaming session. That being said, I have read complaints about this game being 'Pay to Win,' and I must say, that's just not the case. Such an accusation likely comes from the fact that you can buy in-game currency to purchase booster packs, but, this game offers daily quests, worth plenty of currency and at no cost to the player, thus offering an equal chance to earn booster packs, just at a lesser pace. If you have the time, you can be on par with players who purchase a lot of booster packs, therefore creating a nice balance in gameplay.  So, if you are thinking about downloading this game, go ahead and do it, I'm sure you will be rewarded with an enjoyable experience.

Saw this pop up and I was waiting for a new card game from Steam (played Hearthstone after Epic Card battle)  Initial thoughts after clearing the Tutorial.  It is like Hearthstone or Magic the gathering plain and simple BUT what sets it apart from ALL oither card ganes i tried is that it changed the way the board itself is played on.  traditional card games stick with a front and center type of card placement. This game uses a chess board type.  Aside from Attack and Def card attributes there is also a movement speed. This works since you need to move your 'cards' near to attack the other player.  You know the hearthstone cards that give adjacent +1 s to your units. This card game uses that idea in a board type scenario.  I am still new to this but will continue to play for a while
